text:
:mega: Save the date!!

Next rOpenSci Community Call, *From Novice to Contributor: Making and Supporting First-Time Contributions to FOSS*

:calendar: *Monday, 20 January 2025 16:00 UTC* (<https://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?iso=2025-01-20T16%3a00%3a00&ah=1&msg=From%20Novice%20to%20Contributor%3a%20Making%20and%20Supporting%20First-Time%20Contributions%20to%20FOSS%20(rOpenSci%20Comm%20Call)|find your local time>)

with <https://ropensci.org/commcalls/first-time-contributor/|With Yi-Chin Sunny Tseng, Pascal Burkhard, Yaoxiang Li and Hugo Gruson>

More details: <https://ropensci.org/commcalls/first-time-contributor/>

This community call will be followed by two mini-hackathons with hands-on and mentoring sessions with rOpenSci community members and staff so that people can work on their first-time contributions to R packages.  Please help us to spread the word!

attachments.fallback: From Novice to Contributor: Making and Supporting First-Time Contributions to FOSS · Community Call
attachments.text:
Contributing to open source can be very rewarding, but also incredibly intimidating. When we asked about first time contributions on the rOpenSci Slack, people recalled the challenges and mistakes they made, but mostly how much they learned from and enjoyed that experience.
In this community call moderated by Hugo Gruson, our speaker, Yaoxiang Li will discus the importance of tests with respect to first-time contributions, and share best practices and advanced techniques for supercharging R package quality with testthat, Pascal Burkhard will discuss the basic git skills that can help to make a first contribution, and Sunny Tseng will share practical advice for making first contributions, common challenges and how to overcome them.
attachments.title: From Novice to Contributor: Making and Supporting First-Time Contributions to FOSS · Community Call

elements.text:
Save the date!!

Next rOpenSci Community Call,
From Novice to Contributor: Making and Supporting First-Time Contributions to FOSS
With Yi-Chin Sunny Tseng, Pascal Burkhard, Yaoxiang Li and Hugo Gruson

This community call will be followed by two mini-hackathons with hands-on and mentoring sessions with rOpenSci community members and staff so that people can work on their first-time contributions to R packages.  Please help us to spread the word!
